email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available for a laycan of October 20-25. The vessel has a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280 meters. The starting freight rate is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Would you consider $49.50 per metric ton? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s specifications and any additional terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I can bring the rate down to $50.00 per metric ton, but that’s the best I can do given the current market. The MV Ocean Star is in excellent condition, and I’ve attached the full specs for your review. Demurrage is set at $20,000 per day, pro-rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the update. $50.00 per metric ton is acceptable, but could we cap the demurrage at $18,000 per day? Also, can you confirm the laytime window? Looking forward to finalizing this. Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I can agree to cap the demurrage at $18,000 per day. The laytime window is 72 hours total, starting from the vessel’s arrival at the load port. If everything looks good, I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Let me know if you need any further details. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, everything looks good. Please proceed with drafting the charter party agreement. Let’s aim to finalize by end of day. Thanks for your flexibility on the terms. Cheers, John.
